business.headline: New labour codes are here: Will your in-hand salary rise or fall?With the new labour codes now implemented, many employees are trying to understand what it means for their salary structure, especially basic salary, PF deductions and take-home pay.

New labour codes: What changes for paid leave, work hours and health benefitsThe new labour codes apply across sectors and are designed to improve safety, reduce fatigue and make workplaces more predictable for millions of workers.

Gratuity in a year? Only if you're a fixed-term employee. Here's what it meansOnly employees hired on fixed-term contracts qualify for the new one-year gratuity rule. Permanent staff remain under the five-year norm, making this benefit exclusive to India's expanding fixed-term workforce.

From gratuity to gig worker insurance: What new labour laws mean for employeesFrom gratuity to insurance and safer workplaces, the new rules expand what employees can expect from their jobs. Staying informed will help workers make the most of these changes.

Fixed-term employees to get gratuity after 1 year of service under new labour lawsAccording to the Union Labour Ministry, the restructuring is aimed at ensuring better wages, wider social security coverage and improved health-related protections for workers across sectors.

Sensex tumbles 400 points, Nifty ends above 26,000 amid volatile tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex fell more than 400 points to close at 85,231, while the NSE Nifty50 managed to stay above the 26,000 mark despite broad-based weakness across sectors.

Government implements four labour codes, replacing 29 old laws. Check detailsThe move brings together decades-old labour rules that were scattered across multiple legislations into a consolidated framework. Many of these older laws date back to the pre-Independence and early post-Independence era.

Rupee slides to record low of Rs 89.45 amid US-India trade uncertaintyThe outlook for the rupee remains uncertain as global risk sentiment stays fragile and investors wait for clearer signals from both the Fed and ongoing trade negotiations between Washington and New Delhi.

Sudeep Pharma IPO fully subscribed on day 1. Check latest GMP and otherThe issue, priced between Rs 563 and Rs 593, saw a clear surge from retail and high-net-worth investors, allowing the company to cross the one-time subscription mark even though institutional participation remained weak through the first session.

How GMP and social media hype mislead so many first-time investorsThe Great IPO Gamble series ends here, and in part 3, we break down how GMP and social media hype influence first-time investors. A look at the noise behind the numbers.

Recipe for trouble? Zomato's customer data move stirs up controversyZomato controversy: Food delivery giant Zomato has decided to share customer data with restaurants after years of tussle. Politicians and marketing gurus have called it a recipe for trouble, expressing concerns about data privacy and spam messages.

Russian Oil: Reliance Halts Russian Crude Imports at Jamnagar SEZ RefineryThis report covers Reliance Industries' decision to halt the import of Russian crude oil for its export-oriented refinery in Jamnagar, Gujarat. The move is in compliance with European Union and United States sanctions targeting Russian oil majors Rosneft and Lukoil, with a wind-down period ending November 21. Reliance stated, 'we'll stay aligned with government's policy.' The company will now source crude from other regions, including West Asia and the EU, for its Special Economic Zone (SEZ) refinery, with all exports to be derived from non-Russian oil starting December 1. The decision impacts a long-term deal between Reliance and Rosneft for the supply of crude oil.

JP Power share price tumbles 7% after strong rally. Why is it down today?The JP Power share price dip reflects profit-taking after a steep run, as the market waits for clearer evidence that the broader group's restructuring will lift the company's long-term fortunes.

Groww shares jump nearly 7% after two-day tumble: What's driving today's rally?Around 10:03 am, the shares of the company were trading 6.30% higher at Rs 166.44 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The rebound comes amid growing anticipation around Groww's performance.

Sensex, Nifty fall in early trade as hopes of US rate cut fadeAround 9:23 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 131 points at 85,501.03, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 40.70 points to 26,151.45. Volatility was high in early trade and all major sectoral indices were in the red, reflecting the cautious mood on Dalal Street.

Reliance ends use of Russian crude for exports to comply with EU sanctionsReliance's decision shows how quickly the global rules around Russian oil are changing, and how Indian refiners are now being pushed to realign their supply chains.

Reliance Group says ED-attached assets belong to RCom, not part of group since 2019The ED, meanwhile, detailed its searches across Tamil Nadu in a land-forgery and inflated compensation scam involving forged deeds, dummy buyers and layered transactions, seizing and freezing assets worth Rs 18.10 crore.

Waiting for your tax refund? Here's why it's delayed and when it may arriveAccording to the Income Tax Department, more than 7.57 crore returns were filed by September 23, yet refunds for many taxpayers remain pending.

Sensex ends nearly 450 points higher, Nifty nears life-time highThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 446.21 points to close at 85,632.68, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 139.50 points to finish at 26,192.15. Broader indices were mixed, but the tone across frontline stocks remained firmly positive, led by gains in heavyweight financial counters.

Sensex surges 500 points, Nifty nears life-time high. What's driving the rally?At 1.58 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 526.63 points to 85,713.10, while the NSE Nifty50 hit a fresh 52-week high and was nearing an all-time high of 26,277.

entertainment.headline: Palash Muchhal and Smriti Mandhana's mehendi is all about love. Pics Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana and music composer Palash Muchhal continued their wedding celebrations with a vibrant mehendi ceremony following the haldi event. Pictures from the pre-wedding festivties have gon viral.

Punjabi singer Harman Sidhu dies in a road accident at 37 Punjabi singer Harman Sidhu died in a road accident on the Mansa-Patiala road after his car collided with a truck. The singer died on the spot.

I haven't written a single original song, says lyricist Manoj Muntashir Manoj Muntashir spoke about his journey and the myth of originality at Sahitya AajTak 2025. His reflections highlighted the importance of inspiration and learning in creative writing.

Adarsh Gourav washed dishes for Rs 100 a day to prep for The White Tiger Actor Adarsh Gourav shared his intense preparation for 'The White Tiger', where he worked as a daily wage labourer to deeply understand his character Balram. At the stage of Sahitya Aaj Tak 2025, the actor was joined by Anya Singh.

Anya Singh praises Aryan Khan's nuanced direction on The Ba***ds of Bollywood During her session at Sahitya AajTak 2025, actor Anya Singh shared her experience of working with director Aryan Khan in 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood.'

Ram Gopal Varma lashes out at iBomma supporters over piracy debate Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma, in a post, suggested criminalising viewers of pirated content. The Telugu film industry and police have intensified efforts against piracy, following the arrest of Immadhi Ravi, alleged operator of the iBomma site.

Nepotism helps with entry, not success: Actor Amol Palekar on Bollywood's reality At Sahitya Aaj Tak 2025, veteran actor and filmmaker Amol Palekar said nepotism may open doors, but only talent and hard work lead to real success. He also urged audiences to measure films beyond box office numbers.

Jaideep Ahlawat wants to play Srikant in The Family Man film, Manoj Bajpayee reacts In an exclusive interview with India Today, 'The Family Man 3' team spoke about their plans of converting the popular series into a film like 'Mirzapur.'

Tu Meri Main Tera teaser: Kartik, Ananya promise sparks and Christmas mush The teaser for 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri', starring Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday, has been released, offering audiences a glimpse into a holiday romance set to premiere on December 25, 2025.

Kartik Aaryan celebrates birthday on Naagzilla set, grooves to Bhojpuri hits Actor Kartik Aaryan celebrated his 35th birthday on November 22 while working on the set of his upcoming film 'Naagzilla'. Several pictures and videos of the actor's dance performance on the set have emerged online.

Exclusive: Last Samurai Standing's Junichi Okada studies Indian films; here's why With 'Last Samurai Standing', Japan brings a survival-action drama rooted in physical performance and traditional craft, earning early comparisons to 'Squid Game'. Lead actor Junichi Okada highlights minimal CGI and real effort, hoping the series connects with Indian audiences and sparks cultural collaboration.

The Family Plan 2 review: Wahlberg, Monaghan's Christmas film loses narrative sparkRelease Date:Fri Nov 21, 2025 'The Family Plan 2' offers formulaic holiday fun, powered by the effortless chemistry between Mark Wahlberg and Michelle Monaghan. Although the film struggles with predictable tropes and pacing, it ultimately anchors its charm in the warm, dysfunctional family dynamics rather than groundbreaking action or narrative risk.

Kamal Haasan mourns Wing Commander Namansh Syal, calls him India's pride Wing Commander Namansh Syal of the Indian Air Force died in a Tejas crash during rehearsals for the Dubai Airshow 2025. His death has sparked nationwide grief, with tributes pouring in from Kamal Haasan, among others.

Kamal Haasan, Kushboo Sundar, Suhasini reunite at IFFI Goa, learn about cinema Kamal Haasan, Suhasini and Kushboo Sundar reunited at IFFI Goa, sharing a warm moment that reflected their long-standing bond and love for cinema. The actors shared a bunch of photos on Instagram.

Cardi B turns newborn's umbilical cord into gold pendant, internet stops to blink Cardi B has celebrated the arrival of her fourth child, her first with Stefon Diggs, by turning her son's umbilical cord into a gold pendant and preserving other personal birth mementos.

Guide: A Timeless Dance of Destiny, Liberation, and Love As part of our Retro Review series we revisit Vijay Anand's Guide. One of the greatest Indian movies, 'Guide' masterfully blends captivating performances, evocative music, and innovative storytelling to explore the transformative journey of two souls navigating art, love, and destiny's diktats

Tu Meri Zindagi Hai to Naagzilla: Inside Kartik Aaryan's power-packed film slate As Kartik Aaryan celebrates his birthday, his upcoming slate signals one of the most ambitious phases of his career. From the comfort of 'Tu Meri Main Tera...' to the high-stakes leap of 'Naagzilla', the next year charts a bold shift.

Legend of Begum Akhtar: How AIR Lucknow recorded her secret return after 8 years Begum Akhtar made a silent musical comeback through a secret recording by AIR Lucknow's then-director LK Malhotra. Writer Yatindra Mishra, speaking at Sahitya AajTak, shared her comeback story.

Kapoors spill secrets: Ranbir eats the most, Kareena says none have filters The Kapoor family share amusing insights on candidness and appetite, with Ranbir Kapoor singled out as the biggest glutton. The clip has been shared on Netflix's Instagram page.

general news.headline: J&K electrician detained in Delhi blast case, suspected Jaish links under probeSources say the investigation has uncovered strong leads suggesting his involvement in the conspiracy, prompting deeper scrutiny of his role in the network.

From skills boost to countering drug-terror: PM outlines key initiatives at G20  UpdatesAt the first G20 Summit hosted in Africa, Prime Minister Narendra Modi opened the proceedings with a call to rethink global growth frameworks and unveiled three sweeping proposals, a traditional knowledge repository, a continent-wide skills multiplier for Africa, and a joint push to dismantle the drug–terror nexus.

New, clear Tejas jet crash video suggests pilot tried to eject last minuteTejas jet crash: The Tejas jet of the IAF was executing a low-altitude aerobatic manoeuvre when it went down at the Dubai Airshow, erupting into a massive fireball. The new video provides a clear picture of what transpired in the final moments.

Central panel tightens pollution curbs in Delhi as air quality remains very poorThe Commission for Air Quality Management has tightened pollution-control measures in Delhi-NCR by revising GRAP, shifting several curbs to lower stages as air quality stays in the 'Very Poor' category.

Ranveer Singh, Trump Jr trend, Janhvi and Shahid perform at billionaire weddingBollywood celebrities and international stars gathered in Udaipur for the lavish wedding of US-based billionaire Padmaja and Rama Raju Mantena's daughter, Netra. Ranveer Singh and other performers entertained guests, including Donald Trump Jr and Bettina Anderson.

From gratuity to gig worker insurance: What new labour laws mean for employeesFrom gratuity to insurance and safer workplaces, the new rules expand what employees can expect from their jobs. Staying informed will help workers make the most of these changes.

Not a Malayali? No problem. Here's why Malayalam films still make senseMalayalam movies are taking over India — not with hype, but with heart. Real characters, real emotions, zero drama-for-the-sake-of-drama. No Malayalam? No problem. The storytelling does the talking.

Major arms racket busted in Delhi, China-made weapons were supplied from PakThe syndicate, linked to Pakistan's ISI, used to supply the consignments of high-end China and Turkey-made weapons to Lawrence Bishnoi and other notorious gangs in the Delhi-NCR and its surrounding states.
Do IV drips belong at weddings? The risks are too serious to ignoreIf you spot an IV drip bar at the next wedding you attend, think twice before signing up as it could lead to serious health risks.

Ashes: England have a Travis Head-ache and Indian fans aren't complainingAshes 2025: Whether in Ahmedabad or Perth, Travis Head has a habit of lighting up November. India exhaled this time — and England got a taste of the chaos he can create.

Jab at Congress? Shashi Tharoor's cryptic post on Trump-Mamdani meetCongress MP Shashi Tharoor shared a video of the cordial meeting between Donald Trump and NYC Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani, who belong to two different parties, calling it an example of how democracies should function.
India's enormous Tejas stakesThe tragic crash in Dubai notwithstanding, India has no option but to push its light combat aircraft project.

Lost in translation: Indian techie terrified after Uber driver's message misreads as threatA Meta techie's Uber ride turned frightening due to a wrong auto-translated message from the driver, and no one was prepared for what the original message from the driver was.

CGC University, Mohali: Where vision becomes legacy and education becomes evolutionStories of students who dare to dream, of educators who ignite curiosity, and of a community that chooses progress with purpose.

US lawmaker who wanted to kill H-1B programme to resign amid Trump feudRepublican Congresswoman Marjorie Taylor Greene, who proposed a bill to end the H-1B visa programme, has announced she would resign as a lawmaker. Greene, a longtime Donald Trump ally, had clashed with the US President recently, and took a confrontationist stand on the H-1B programme.

Congress forms panel to hold seat-sharing talks with DMK for 2026 Tamil Nadu pollsThe Congress team tasked with holding talks with the ruling DMK will be led by the party in-charge for Tamil Nadu and Puducherry, Girish Chodankar.

Nepotism helps with entry, not success: Actor Amol Palekar on Bollywood's realityAt Sahitya Aaj Tak 2025, veteran actor and filmmaker Amol Palekar said nepotism may open doors, but only talent and hard work lead to real success. He also urged audiences to measure films beyond box office numbers.

India's first woman spy who ran missions before intelligence had a nameShe fought an empire with nothing but courage and silence. India may have moved on, but her shadows still guard our freedom story..

Woman alleges sex exploitation by partner for 5 years on pretext of marriageA woman from Muzaffarpur has accused her partner of exploiting her for five years under the false promise of marriage, involving sexual abuse and theft of gold jewellery. The case has sparked a police investigation highlighting growing concerns over exploitation via social media.

sports.headline: Smith reveals how injured Khawaja sensed Head's heroics: One of the best back spasms Ashes: Australia benefited from an unexpected change at the top after Usman Khawaja's back spasm opened the door for Travis Head, whose blistering 123 powered them to an eight-wicket win in the Perth Test.

Returning where I started my journey: Ravindra Jadeja on Rajasthan Royals homecoming Ravindra Jadeja says his return to Rajasthan Royals after fifteen years feels like a full-circle moment, taking him back to the franchise where he began his IPL journey and earned the nickname "Rockstar." He discussed his bond with Shane Warne, working with RR's young core and how the trade back to Jaipur unfolded.

Head's knock one of the best I've seen: McCullum stunned by batter's Perth heroics Ashes: Travis Head's extraordinary 123 off 83 balls earned high praise from England coach Brendon McCullum, who called it one of the best pressure innings he has ever seen after Australia cruised to an eight-wicket win in the Perth Test.

Kuldeep Yadav is India's X-factor on lifeless Guwahati pitch: Assistant coach IND vs SA: Kuldeep Yadav's three-wicket burst on a largely unresponsive Guwahati pitch kept India in control on Day 1 of the second Test. His strikes stalled South Africa's momentum and underlined his growing importance in India's red-ball plans.

Vaughan rips into Bazball after Perth Test: Can't be competitive without brains Michael Vaughan blasted England's approach after their Perth defeat, questioning their shot selection against Mitchell Starc and warning they "can't be competitive without brains." The former captain said England must adapt their aggressive style or risk being "hammered" as the Ashes series moves to Brisbane.

Taijul Islam scripts history as Bangladesh on cusp of series win over Ireland BAN vs IRE: Bangladesh tightened their grip on the Mirpur Test as Taijul Islam became the country's leading Test wicket-taker and reduced Ireland to 176/6, still 333 runs from their target of 509.

Ashes: England have a Travis Head-ache and Indian fans aren't complaining Ashes 2025: Whether in Ahmedabad or Perth, Travis Head has a habit of lighting up November. India exhaled this time — and England got a taste of the chaos he can create.

The Ashes: Ben Stokes left shell-shocked by Travis Head masterclass in Perth Test Travis Head blasted a stunning 123 off 83 balls to lead Australia to an eight-wicket win over England in the first Ashes Test in Perth. Ben Stokes admitted he was left "shell-shocked" by the innings as Australia chased 205 with ease to take a 1–0 series lead.

Shortest Ashes Test in 137 years. Head's rapid ton: Unmissable stats from Perth Travis Head's blistering 123 off 83 balls powered Australia to a dominant two-day, eight-wicket win in Perth to take a 1–0 lead in the Ashes. The Perth Test was also a witness to several records being broken.

IND v SA 2nd Test: After Kolkata chaos, Kuldeep drags India ahead in Guwahati slugfest Kuldeep Yadav's three-wicket haul helped India inch ahead on Day 1 of the Guwahati Test. South Africa batters got starts but failed to capitalise on a track that looks to be in stark contrast to the one on offer at the Eden Gardens during the first Test.

Taijul Islam scripts history as Bangladesh on cusp of series win over Ireland BAN vs IRE: Bangladesh tightened their grip on the Mirpur Test as Taijul Islam became the country's leading Test wicket-taker and reduced Ireland to 176/6, still 333 runs from their target of 509.

IND v SA 2nd Test: After Kolkata chaos, Kuldeep drags India ahead in Guwahati slugfest Kuldeep Yadav's three-wicket haul helped India inch ahead on Day 1 of the Guwahati Test. South Africa batters got starts but failed to capitalise on a track that looks to be in stark contrast to the one on offer at the Eden Gardens during the first Test.

Travis Head grabs Bazball by the scruff, stuns England in 2-day Perth TestAustralia vs England, 1st Test: As wickets tumbled and chaos reigned in the first five sessions in Perth, Travis Head rose above the rubble, delivering a knock for the ages that turned a frantic two-day contest into Australia's emphatic opening statement of the Ashes.

Perth masterstroke: Sent to open, Travis Head smashes 2nd fastest Ashes hundredTravis Head smashed the second-fastest century in Ashes history after being promoted to open the batting, igniting widespread debate over whether Australia have discovered their next Test opener. His dominant display triggered a wave of social media reactions praising his big-match temperament and ability to dismantle England's Bazball approach.

NZ vs WI: Henry, Chapman star as New Zealand complete whitewash in HamiltonNew Zealand defeated West Indies by four wickets in Hamilton, sealing a 3–0 sweep. Standout bowling from Matt Henry and a steady partnership between Mark Chapman and Michael Bracewell were key to the result.

Resurgent Lakshya Sen wins 86-minute marathon to storm into finalLakshya Sen reached the Australian Open final with a dramatic comeback win over second seed Chou Tien Chen. Sen prevailed 17-21, 24-22, 21-16 in a tense semifinal, booking his place in the title match after 86 minutes of high-intensity badminton on Saturday in Sydney.

The Ashes: Mitchell Starc becomes first pacer in 12 years to take a 10-wicket haulMitchell Starc delivered a sensational ten-wicket match haul in Perth, becoming the first pacer in 12 years to achieve the feat in the Ashes. His dismissals of Crawley, Root and Stokes powered Australia to control as he also crossed 200 World Test Championship wickets, joining an elite bowling group.

Coach Sunil Joshi faces heat over Vaibhav Suryavanshi Super Over blunderIndia A suffered a semi-final loss to Bangladesh A in the Asia Cup Rising Stars 2025 on Friday. The omission of star batter Vaibhav Suryavanshi in the Super Over has sparked widespread criticism and debate.

Las Vegas GP: Norris takes pole, Hamilton dead last in qualifyingLando Norris secured pole position for the Las Vegas Grand Prix in challenging wet conditions, edging out Max Verstappen, while title rival Oscar Piastri settled for fifth on the grid. Lewis Hamilton had a qualifying to forget as he finished in 20th spot.

Watch: Stuart Broad's on-air meltdown goes viral after Joe Root's twin failureAshes 1st Test, AUS vs ENG: Stuart Broad was left speechless as he watched Joe Root fail for the second time in the first Test. Mitchell Starc ran riot, completing a 10-wicket haul in Perth on Saturday.

The Ashes: Mitchell Starc becomes first pacer in 12 years to take a 10-wicket haulMitchell Starc delivered a sensational ten-wicket match haul in Perth, becoming the first pacer in 12 years to achieve the feat in the Ashes. His dismissals of Crawley, Root and Stokes powered Australia to control as he also crossed 200 World Test Championship wickets, joining an elite bowling group.

Coach Sunil Joshi faces heat over Vaibhav Suryavanshi Super Over blunderIndia A suffered a semi-final loss to Bangladesh A in the Asia Cup Rising Stars 2025 on Friday. The omission of star batter Vaibhav Suryavanshi in the Super Over has sparked widespread criticism and debate.

Las Vegas GP: Norris takes pole, Hamilton dead last in qualifyingLando Norris secured pole position for the Las Vegas Grand Prix in challenging wet conditions, edging out Max Verstappen, while title rival Oscar Piastri settled for fifth on the grid. Lewis Hamilton had a qualifying to forget as he finished in 20th spot.

Watch: Stuart Broad's on-air meltdown goes viral after Joe Root's twin failureAshes 1st Test, AUS vs ENG: Stuart Broad was left speechless as he watched Joe Root fail for the second time in the first Test. Mitchell Starc ran riot, completing a 10-wicket haul in Perth on Saturday.

Bavuma's quiet captaincy, no superstars: Jonty Rhodes on South Africa's resurgenceSouth Africa's resurgence in Test cricket is built on belief, resilience, and a new leadership identity under Temba Bavuma. With historic wins at home and abroad, the Proteas are redefining what it means to be a modern Test powerhouse.

Greatest return catch? Watch Mitchell Starc's age-defying effort in Perth TestAustralia vs England, Ashes 1st Test: Mitchell Starc, 35, pulled off a sensational return catch to hand Zak Crawley a pair in Perth. Having taken seven in the first innings, the senior fast bowler struck early again on Saturday, with many wondering whether his effort was one of the greatest return catches in cricket history.

New captain, same old luck as Rishabh Pant loses toss in GuwahatiIndia vs South Africa, 2nd Test: India's stand-in captain Rishabh Pant lost the coin toss as South Africa opted to bat in Guwahati. India made two changes to their XI for the must-win match.

USA cricketer charged for ICC anti-corruption code breachUSA cricketer Akhilesh Reddy has been provisionally suspended after the ICC charged him with three breaches of its Anti-Corruption Code during the 2025 Abu Dhabi T10 tournament. Reddy now has 14 days to respond as the ICC, acting for the Emirates Cricket Board, proceeds with its investigation.

2nd Test Day 1 Highlights : India inch ahead with 4 wickets in final sessionIndia vs South Africa Highlights 2nd Test Day 1 Updates: South Africa started off strongly with a solid partnership at the top, but India managed to find their groove in the final stages of the day's play, taking four wickets in the final session.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
